== Releases ==
== Releases ==
â
Kubuntu follows the same naming/versioning system as Ubuntu, with each release having a code name, and a version number based on the year and month of release. Canonical provides support and security updates for most Kubuntu versions for 18 months after release.<ref>{{ cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/releases/ |title=Ubuntu Releases FAQ | accessdate=2006-12-21}}</ref> Both [[LiveCD|Desktop CD]]s and Alternative (installation) CDs for x86 and AMD64 platforms are available.<br>
+
Kubuntu follows the same naming/versioning system as Ubuntu, with each release having a code name, and a version number based on the year and month of release. Canonical provides support and security updates for most Kubuntu versions for 18 months after release.<ref>{{ cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/releases/ |title=Ubuntu Releases FAQ | accessdate=2006-12-21}}</ref> Both [[Live CD|Desktop CD]]s and Alternative (installation) CDs for x86 and AMD64 platforms are available.<br>
Kubuntu is available both with KDE 3.5 and KDE 4.
Kubuntu is available both with KDE 3.5 and KDE 4.
